1.content: First off, who are you?
1.title: One shall stand......one shall fall.

124.content:
You are Rachel Fields, and you are one badass US Marine.

That's what you keep telling yourself, anyway, as you ride the C130 to your first posting.

In reality, you're a recent graduate of the University of Western Alabama (whose mascot is the Largemouth Bass), which you attended on a Marine Corps ROTC scholarship. Now you are a newly commissioned second lieutenant, riding on a C130 to your first assignment.

This was probably not how your parents saw your life turning out, a fact for which you are truly thankful.

Twenty two years ago, you were born on a hippy commune in Eastern Tennessee, where the highlights of your education was learning that mathematics and physics propagate racism, there are a hundred and sixty-noun pronouns (according to the elders of your commune) which every enlightened person should know by heart, and the number of ways in which kale can be prepared approaches infinity.

Growing up, you time was pretty much your own. Your clothes were made primarily of hemp, scraps, or some combination thereof. By age ten, you were used to being paraded around as a potential victim of the country's immigration policies (even though you were born in this country, and your maternal grandmother, who was born in Mexico, was a legally naturalized citizen), At age eleven, you were helping people in your commune fill out forms for government subsidies.

At age twelve. when you were told one of the elders would help you escape western expectations of your femininity by taking your virginity on your fourteenth birthday, you decided to take steps to prevent that from happening.

As was said earlier, a lot of your time was your own. So on sunny days, you made the five mile trek to the county library and its internet connected computer.

At age thirteen, you filed to become emancipated. You told your parents it was because you could not be a willing puppet of hierarchical neoEurocentric nuclear traditions. So your parents proudly signed the papers giving you freedom from their parental authority.

One day later, your widowed maternal grandfather, retired Marine Colonel Daniel Fields (whom your mother was rebelling against, and whom you had contacted by email once you discovered him) came to pick you up and take you to his mountain cabin.

Your parents were furious, but they had given you the keys to your freedom, and you ran with them.

They fought it, of course, and even took the surprisingly radical step of hiring someone to try to kidnap you back to the commune. Your grandfather was in his fifties, and the three kidnappers were in their twenties.

Your grandfather kicked their collective asses without even breaking a sweat.

Your grandfather was strict but loving, and you flourished under his guidance. By the time you were eighteen, you had overcome all the non-education of the first twelve years of your life.

You told your grandfather you wanted to be a Marine officer, just like him. So he got you a MCROTC Scholarship to Western Alabama. It was a little podunk college, but it did have a kickass electronic engineering department. By the time you graduated, you were a witch at anything electronic, whether it was hacking, flying a drone, repairing or assessing any device...you name it, you could fix it. Which is why If someone at Western Alabama needed something fixed, they called for you, the Green Witch.

But you wanted to make sure everyone knew you weren't just a techie. You were a hard driving Marine. You worked hard to get an incredibly fit body. You thought your looks were a little against you (many people thought you looked like a younger, Latina Demi Moore, with a softer voice and facial features), but wherever they sent you, you were going to make sure that everyone knew you were lean, green and mean.

You silently repeated this mantra to yourself as the C130 you were riding to you to your first posting
124.title: Rachel

1241.content:
(Set a couple of years before the events of the first Transformer movie)

Your orders are fairly cut and dry. You're to report to Camp Pendleton for further training and, from there, well, you'll see where the Corps wants to send you a couple of months from now.

Except you might be getting new orders.

The C130 you were riding on, along with other marines, just got diverted. You're not sure where you are, as nobody is answering questions. All the passengers are confused, and there's a lot of speculation about what's happening. Looking outside, you see you've landed somewhere in the middle of a desert, but besides your airplane and a depilated looking hanger and a couple of abandoned buildings, there is nothing in sight.

Your thoughts are interrupted by an air force major and a dark haired civilian in a suit boarding the plane. They exchange a few words with the flight crew, and the civilian reaches into his jacket and produces some kind of leather encased identification. Whatever the civilian shows them, it makes the crew immediately come to attention and even from your seat, you can hear the torrent of "yes sirs and no sirs."

The air force major addresses the passengers collectively, telling all of you that there is an emergency, and they need your help. There are some politely offered complaints, as one or two of the passengers were heading toward Pendleton for their final discharge, while a handful of others have time sensitive appointments.

The major says there is no choice, and anyway, the plane isn't going anywhere soon.

An air force tech sergeant comes on board and presents a manifest of all the passengers on the C130 to the major. The major says he will read off the list of names, directing each person called to either follow the major, the tech sergeant, or the civilian, to a building where they will be fully briefed.

When your name is called, you are directed to with the group following
1241.title: Camp Pendleton

1242.content:
You weren't really sure what you were expecting when you arrived at Quantico.

Being shown a cubicle with boxes and piles of printout wasn't it.

You were also shown where the cafeteria was that the people in your building share. It's a mishmash of military personnel, government employees and civilian contractors. You show your identification every morning to a pair of marine guards, but there's no clear indication of who is in charge of the building.

After a couple of weeks, you learn there isn't a single agency in charge of the building. It's where everybody puts data that has be sorted through, but the data itself isn't considered a top priority. So your building is where that data and its associated data sorters go. The people you meet in the cafeteria are either newbies like yourself, old timers months from retirement, or incompetents who can't be fired, so they're shuffled off where they can't do any damage.

After a couple of months, you get into a routine, You wake up, you do your morning run, you go to work, you go to gym, you do your evening run and you go to sleep. You repeat each workday, spend time with new friends on the weekend, and just count the days until your first year is up and you get a real assignment.

And then something changes.

You're about five months into your assignment, listening to some random space noise the radio telescope in puerto rico picked up, perusing the accompanying hard copy on your desk, and getting ready to mark it as "Reviewed, no relevant data found," when something about the random pattern nags at you. You study it for a second, then remember something from a file you have on an incident that happened
1242.title: Quantico

1243.content:
You just left Hawaii, and are pretty excited to be flying to Japan for your first posting. Of course, you're trying to look as dour as possible, because you're not the only Marine on the flight, and you're trying your best to project "stolid Marine officer, not "silly college girl on her first trip overseas."

You're so focused on maintaining an aura that the C130 taking a sudden dive caught you totally by surprise. Outside, large pieces of metal are falling around as the C130 tries to avoid them all. The middle aged gunnery sergeant across the plane from you yells out, "Check your straps, Lieutenant. This is going to get bumpy."

Before you can respond, there is a big explosion, and you find yourself descending into darkness. When you wake up, you're on a tropical beach
1243.title: Camp Butler

1244.content:
Special Operations Command, Central, Qatar. It was described to you as the jumping off point for all the "shooters and looters" operating in South Asia and Middle East.

You tried to exude an air of "badass-ness" to the rest of the passengers of the C130 you were riding on. When you made the transfer in Turkey to the plane you're riding, you knew you were in over your head. The guys you were riding didn't just ignore you. They didn't even acknowledge your existence. They exchanged stories, greetings and stories, all without considering their was a woman and officer in their midst.

[Before we begin this story, does your C130 lands a few days before the attack on the base as depicted in the first movie, a half hour before the attack occurs, or just a couple of minutes before the attack occurs?]
1244.title: Qatar

1245.content:
Shanghai's going to be the witness
To the ultimate test in cerebral fitness

That was Skids rapping the old Murray Head song, with his brother jumping in from time to time, both of them totally wrecking the song.

The rest of the human passengers in the back of the C130 just ignored them, talking among themselves.

You're over in the corner, by yourself, the stranger in the mix. The two four meter tall autobots took notice of you when you boarded the C130 in Oknawa, but are thankfully distracted by each other right now.

How you got here, you haven't a clue.

You're just a newly commissioned second lieutenant, recently graduated from a podunk university. You have no idea why someone picked you to be on the NEST strike team. Heck, until you got your orders just a few minutes after getting off an airplane in Okinawa, you didn't know that NEST existed.

But as soon as you deplaned in Okinawa, you were handed orders to report to a Major Lennox in Shanghai, with whom you would rendezvous for "immediate mission deployment," whatever that meant.

You're fairly sure if they knew about your particular kink, they wouldn't let you anywhere near an Autobot.

The thing is, you have...fantasies...about the autobots. Not the smaller ones, like the twins riding with you. Oh hell no. But the bigger ones. The ones that you could fit comfortably into their hands.

Nothing painful. But you know that they have rubbery, squishy parts that could gently handle your rubbery, squishy parts.

It's a fantasy you've never talked about, and there's no electronic trail leading you to the kinkier parts of the internet. You know, the parts of the internet with those kind of forums talking about your kink.

You do make a thorough study of anything and everything that is declassified enough for you to get to read, but then again, every techie on the planet does the same thing, and you're pretty sure that they all don't share your particular kink.

Your musings are suddenly interrupted as the C130 is bumped as it
1245.title: Shanghai

choices: Jetfire (50 feet tall and who begins the story as an Autobot)
12451.content:
One moment, you're in the back of the C130, lost in your own thoughts, heading to the coast of China.

The next, you're free falling, as the remains of the airplane you were riding is falling around you.

What you don't know is that you and the other members of NEST who were on the plane were on your way to Shanghai to flush out and capture/destroy a small group of Decipticons. Said Decipticons knew their days were numbered, and released an ancient weapon they didn't quite understand.

The weapon in question destroyed the Decipticons in order to fuel itself, then sought out the weakest Autobots in the area. Which happened to be Skids and his brother.

The other Autobots, already in Shanghai, joined the battle and were able to defeat this new weapon. Surprisingly, even though the C130 was destroyed in midair, there were no casualties, either among the Autobots or their human allies.

Well, the rest of NEST thought that there were two casualties, but that was only because you and an Autobot had fallen through a dimensional portal created by the weapon. You and the Autobat in question survived, though both of you are now on a deserted tropical island. The night sky looks like the view from Earth, but your Autobot companion is unable to contact any other members of NEST.

Which Autobot are you stranded on the island with?
12451.title: comes under attack

124513.content:
At sixty foot tall, Nightingale was possibly the gentlest of all the Autobots, preferring diplomacy and reason over combat. However, Nightingale was possibly the most fearless of the Autobots, willing to rush into the fiercest firefights to save a fallen comrade.

Like his friend and mentor Ratchet, Nightingale is a medical officer who has taken an interest in organic lifeforms. And where Ratchet transforms into an H2 Hummer Search and Rescue vehicle, Nightingale morphs into a McDonnell Douglas DC9 aeromedical transport aircraft. He also possesses a deep, melodious soothing bass voice which can neutralize sonic attacks.

At the beginning of your time marooned on a tropical island with Nightingale, he finds himself stuck in his Autobot form, unable to transform to a jet. He is also unable to fly or contact the other Autobots, though he is otherwise fully functional. Your story begins as he had recently rescued you as you both fall through the dimensional portal. You are sprawled out in his right hand, disheveled and
124513.title: An original autobot

1245132.content:
You're not aware of this fact, but Nightingale is fascinated by human beings. Of course, his friend and mentor Ratchet is fascinated by human beings, but Ratchet's fascination is more academic and even philanthropic.

Nightingale's fascination with humans, and especially female humans, is more akin to your fascination with transformers.

Unknown to you, Nightingale has never had the opportunity to indulge his fascination. Until now.

And now, you are unconscious in his hand. And you possess the female human form that Nightingale has always been fascinated with.

Nightingale begins gently stroking your hair.

You
1245132.title: unconscious

choices: Perhaps you should set me down
Perhaps you should continue your examination, to make sure I'm okay
Any idea about where we might be?
12451322.content:
You feel someone gently stroking your hair. You didn't get a buzz when you went into ROTC. You got a nice, sensible cut that barely reached your shoulders. It was manageable, didn't interfere with your duties, but let you remain feminine.

The gentle stroking morphed into a dream of you as a teenager, when your grandfather took time in the morning to brush the snarls out of your hair. You made a little 'mmmmm' sound at the dream memory.

Then you remember being shot down, and you woke up with a start, finding yourself in Nightingale's hand, with his face filling your vision. The finger on the other hand that had been stroking your hair had quickly moved away, almost guiltily.

"Sorry, I was just making sure you were okay," Nightingale responded, Was that a hint of nervousness in his voice?

Regardless, you nod, then say
12451322.title: wake up under Nightingale's touch

choices: the two of you explore your surroundings
he continue his medical examination of you
124513223.content:
You don't suggest that Nightingale set you down, and he makes no move to do so. You're not sure what you thought it would be like to be held by an autobot, but Nightingale's hand feels like the most comfortable reclining chair you could imagine. The finger that had been stroking your hand felt like very soft, supple leather. There was nothing hard or metallic about it. You're not sure if this is what every Transformer's touch would feel like, or just Nightingale's, since he's a medically oriented Autobot.

"So any idea about where we might be?" you ask.

"No clue," Nightingale responded. "My flight and transformation capabilities seem to be malfunctioning, although the rest of my systems are functioning at optimum performance. I'm unable to communicate or broadcast with any autobots, and I'm unable to establish an uplink with any satellites. The island we're on doesn't match the topographical details of any known island in my database."

You nod as you listening, surprised that you're not panicking. Perhaps it's the fact that you're reclining in Nightingale's hand that is keeping you calm. You're concerned, of course, but somehow you're managing to keep your cool.

After Nightingale finishes his analysis of the situation, you suggest
124513223.title: Any idea about where we might be?

choices: answer that you're okay, and ask to be set down on the ground
1245132233.content:
"If you're through with your self-diagnostic," you hear yourself saying, "Maybe you should make sure I'm okay as well."

Nightingale is silent for a minute, and you're about to say something, ,when he responds, "I found no signs of concussion or other head injuries. But for a more thorough examination, you should disrobe."

Now it's your turn to be startled. After a little hesitation, you
1245132233.title: Continued medical examination

12452.content:
The C130 bumps a couple of times as it touches down at a mostly deserted airport at Shanghai. Undoubtedly the airport has either been cleared for your arrival, or its an airport that's kept intentionally isolated and minimally staffed for the arrival of airplanes like yours.

As you depart the aircraft, the passengers of your airplane are met by
12452.title: lands at the Shanghai airport.

choices: go to visit your uncle in his new house
attend a unique and advanced "space camp"
travel to Tibet to further your martial arts training
143.content:
(Set just prior to the events depicted in the movie Transformers: Dark of the Moon)

You're not sure what to make of your "uncle," former Seven Sector Agent Seymour Simmons. But he had definitely made your childhood interesting.

The only daughter of your single parent mother, Prisha Laghari (a second generation Indian-Canadian), nobody ever explained to you why you were christened with the name Bethany Anne Simmons. It definitely sounds something you name a blonde hair blue eyed girl. Not someone with your brown eyes, black hair and olive complexion,

At age four, you were introduced to your "Uncle" Seymour, who ensured that over the next fourteen years,you had an extensive, if eclectic, education.

Your visitations with your uncle Seymour were sporadic, and each time he suggested a different familial relationship with you. This includes you being his half-sister or his illegitimate daughter. You were never sure what to believe, but whatever your real relationship was with Seymour Simmons, you definitely benefited from it.

Your mother was totally disinterested in you, allowing a long line of tutors, instructors and private teachers to raise you. This suited you just fine.

Your mother was more interested in her seemingly unending string of boyfriends. None of these boyfriends ever gave you any trouble, though. They actually seemed to be afraid of you. It appeared that even when he wasn't there, your "uncle" was never far away.

Then, at age eighteen, with the publication of his book Code-Name Hero: How Seymour Simmons & the Aliens Saved the World, you learned a lot more about your uncle than you ever knew. You still didn't know the exact nature of your relationship with him, but at least some of your questions had been answered.

Your adventure begins a couple of days after your eighteenth birthday, when you
143.title: Bethany Simmons

info.brief_description: The Transformers have come to Earth.  What happens?
info.description:
The Autobots and Decepticons have brought there thousand year war to Earth. And your caught in the middle of it. What will happen?

Here are the rules to this interactive
This story is based off of the live-action film series
I'll allow some adult content, but don't go overboard
Use the movie characters or create your own
The main character (you) should stay human
Keep the narrative in first person
Use as much detail as possible
Try to use proper grammar
Thats it, Enjoy.
